item.description:
The Connecticut Audubon Society has a nature center in Glastonbury with educational displays and a live animal center. Behind the center is town owned Earle Park with trails leading down to the Connecticut River. We will visit Tom’s Pond in the park and see the beech woods. This will be a short walk in keeping with the expected hot weather.

You may visit the center after our walk if you like. Admission is by donation.

This will be an easy walk of about 2 miles with easy trails. Social walking pace. We will be out for about 1 hour. The walk will be rescheduled if there is a threat of rain.

Dogs and children are welcome as long as they are calm and well behaved.

Location: 1361 Main St, Glastonbury, CT.
http://maps.google.co...

group.name: The Hartford Area Hiking™ Meetup Group

item.name: Connecticut Audubon Society Walk, Glastonbury, CT
